items.title_en: I want to wash my car. The car wash is 50 meters away. Should I walk or drive?
items.title_zh: 我想洗车。洗车点就在50米外。应该走路还是开车？
items.summary_en: A personal post asks whether to walk or drive to a car wash located about 50 meters away. The question is framed as a simple everyday dilemma, likely discussing convenience, effort, or environmental considerations. The linked item is a Mastodon post by the author.
items.summary_zh: 一则个人帖询问到距离约50米的洗车点应走路还是开车。问题被当作日常小困惑来提出，可能涉及便利性、体力或环保等考量。链接指向作者在 Mastodon 上的帖子。

items.title_en: I’m joining OpenAI

items.title_en: EU bans the destruction of unsold apparel, clothing, accessories and footwear

items.summary_en: An Environment EU news release reports that new EU rules ban the destruction of unsold apparel, clothing, accessories, and footwear. The announcement describes regulatory changes aimed at reducing waste in the fashion sector. The item is published on the European Commission's environment site.

items.title_en: Amazon's Ring and Google's Nest reveal the severity of U.S. surveillance state

items.summary_en: An opinion piece argues that consumer devices from Amazon's Ring and Google's Nest reveal the breadth of surveillance in the U.S. The article likely examines how smart home cameras and services intersect with law enforcement and data access. It appears on Glenn Greenwald's Substack.
items.summary_zh: 一篇观点文章认为，亚马逊 Ring 与谷歌 Nest 的消费类设备揭示了美国监控范围之广。文章可能探讨智能家居摄像头与执法、数据访问之间的关系。该文发布在 Glenn Greenwald 的 Substack 平台上。

items.title_en: 14-year-old Miles Wu folded origami pattern that holds 10k times its own weight

items.summary_zh: GitHub 上的组织页面介绍了 MessageFormat，这是一个用于本地化消息字符串的 Unicode 标准。仓库可能包含规范、工具与国际化工作组的信息。链接指向 Unicode Message Format 工作组在 GitHub 的页面。

items.title_en: I guess I kinda get why people hate AI
items.title_zh: 我想我有点理解为什么人们讨厌 AI
items.summary_en: A personal blog post reflects on reasons why people dislike AI. The author likely shares experiences or examples that shaped their view and explains concerns about AI's impacts. The piece is published on the author's blog.
items.summary_zh: 一篇个人博客文章反思了人们为何讨厌 AI 的原因。作者可能分享形成其观点的经历或例子，并解释对 AI 影响的担忧。文章发布在作者的博客上。

items.title_en: State Attorneys General Want to Tie Online Access to ID
items.title_zh: 州总检察长希望将线上访问与身份证绑在一起
items.summary_en: A news piece reports that State Attorneys General want to tie online access to identity, backing an 'Online Safety Act' that would require IDs. The article likely summarizes the proposal and participating attorneys general. The story is published on ReclaimTheNet.
items.summary_zh: 一则新闻报道称，多位州总检察长希望将线上访问与身份认证捆绑，支持一项可能要求身份证的“在线安全法”。报道可能概述了提案内容及参与的州检察长。该文章刊登于 ReclaimTheNet。

items.title_en: Arm wants a bigger slice of the chip business
items.title_zh: Arm 想要在芯片业务中分得更大份额
items.summary_en: An Economist article examines Arm's ambitions to increase its share of the chip business. The piece likely analyzes Arm's strategy, market position, and industry dynamics. The article is published by The Economist in the business section.
items.summary_zh: 《经济学人》的一篇文章审视了 Arm 希望在芯片业务中扩大份额的雄心。文章可能分析了 Arm 的战略、市场地位和行业动态。该文刊登于《经济学人》商业版块。

items.title_en: AI is going to kill app subscriptions
items.title_zh: AI 将终结应用订阅制
items.summary_en: A blog post argues that AI is going to kill app subscriptions. The author likely discusses how AI changes product distribution, monetization, and user expectations. The piece is published on the NicheHunt blog.
items.summary_zh: 一篇博客文章断言 AI 将终结应用订阅制。作者可能讨论 AI 如何改变产品分发、货币化方式和用户预期。文章发布于 NicheHunt 博客。

items.title_en: Pocketblue – Fedora Atomic for mobile devices
items.title_zh: Pocketblue – 面向移动设备的 Fedora Atomic
items.summary_en: Pocketblue is a GitHub project offering Fedora Atomic tailored for mobile devices. The repository likely includes images, tooling, and documentation for running Fedora Atomically on phones or small devices. The link points to the project's GitHub page.
items.summary_zh: Pocketblue 是一个 GitHub 项目，提供面向移动设备的 Fedora Atomic。仓库可能包含在手机或小型设备上运行 Fedora Atomic 的镜像、工具和文档。链接指向项目的 GitHub 页面。

items.title_zh: 罗伯特·杜瓦尔已去世

items.title_en: WebMCP Proposal
items.title_zh: WebMCP 提案

items.title_en: Why I don't think AGI is imminent
items.title_zh: 为什么我认为通用人工智能并不迫近
items.summary_en: A blog post argues that AGI is not imminent. The author likely details technical, practical, or conceptual reasons for their stance and assesses current progress. The piece is hosted on the author's personal site.

items.title_zh: Wero – 在欧洲打造的数字支付钱包

items.title_en: Picol: A Tcl interpreter in 500 lines of code
items.title_zh: Picol：500 行代码的 Tcl 解释器
items.summary_en: A GitHub repository hosts Picol, a Tcl interpreter implemented in roughly 500 lines of code. The project likely serves as a compact educational implementation or minimalist interpreter. The link goes to the GitHub project page by antirez.

items.title_en: AI optimism is a class privilege
items.title_zh: 对 AI 的乐观是阶级特权
items.summary_en: A blog post argues that AI optimism reflects class privilege. The author likely examines how socioeconomic position shapes perceptions of AI's risks and benefits. The piece is published on Josh Collinsworth's blog.
items.summary_zh: 一篇博客文章认为对 AI 的乐观反映了阶级特权。作者可能分析社会经济地位如何影响人们对 AI 风险与收益的看法。文章发布在 Josh Collinsworth 的博客上。
